elements.title: Horsham Friends Meeting House (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the headstone of George Bax Holmes, who is buried at Horsham Friends Meeting House (pictured), is now a paving slab?

elements.title: King Tornado football (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the King Tornado football team once won by a score of 206–0 – without even playing the full game?

elements.title: Born to Run (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the album cover for Bruce Springsteen's Born to Run has been imitated by several musicians, as well as the Sesame Street characters Bert and Cookie Monster?

elements.title: Hardpoint (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that as part of the Hardpoint missile defense system, ARPA developed missiles able to hit 377 g of acceleration with reaction times in milliseconds?

elements.title: Enass Muzamel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Enass Muzamel established the Sudanese Female Cyclists Initiative to challenge the stigma against women riding bikes in Sudan?

elements.title: Milkrun (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that only months after going out of business, Milkrun relaunched?

elements.title: Aaron Hertzman (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Aaron Hertzman paid $25 to have a team in the National Football League?

elements.title: Rubymar (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Rubymar was the first ship sunk by Houthi missiles during the Red Sea crisis?

elements.title: a Missouri TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a Missouri TV station blew up its call letters – literally?
